docs.lead_paragraph: A transcript of Cuyahoga County prosecutor Timothy McGinty's 15-minute speech to reporters on Monday about a grand jury's decision not to indict two white police officers in the shooting death of Tamir Rice, a 12-year-old black boy who had been playing with a pellet gun outside a recreation center:

headline.main: Prosecutor's Comments on the Tamir Rice Police Shooting Case
headline.print_headline: Prosecutor's Comments on the Tamir Rice Police Shooting Case

docs.snippet: The 12-year-old boy was killed as he was playing with a replica gun in a park. Relatives and activists, who called the shooting senseless, had sought charges in the case....
docs.lead_paragraph: The 12-year-old boy was killed as he was playing with a replica gun in a park. Relatives and activists, who called the shooting senseless, had sought charges in the case.
docs.abstract: Grand jury declines to charge white Cleveland Police Officer Timothy Loehmann, who fatally shot 12-year-old African-American Tamir Rice in 2014, while child was holding pellet gun; decision ends more than year of inquiry into case that fueled national anger over killing of African-Americans by white officers.

headline.main: Cleveland Officer Will Not Face Charges in Tamir Rice Shooting Death
headline.print_headline: Jurors Decline Charges in Death of Cleveland Boy

byline.contributor: Timothy Williams reported from Cleveland, and Mitch Smith from Chicago.
byline.original: By TIMOTHY WILLIAMS and MITCH SMITH

docs.snippet: Thousands of boats are stolen each year, and some are recovered using alcohol, prostitutes, witch doctors and other forms of guile....
docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of boats are stolen each year, and some are recovered using alcohol, prostitutes, witch doctors and other forms of guile.
docs.abstract: Maritime 'repo men' are being hired across globe to locate valuable stolen ships, most of which are small-to-medium cargo vessels that often end up in hands of pirates and human traffickers; local authorities around world regard repo men, usually hired by banks, insurers or shipowners, as vigilantes who cheapen and weaken rule of law (Series: The Outlaw Ocean).

headline.main: Maritime ‘Repo Men’: A Last Resort for Stolen Ships

docs.snippet: In September, U.S. State Department officials invited a foreign delegation to the Guantanamo Bay detention center to persuade the group to take detainee Tariq Ba Odah to their country. If they succeeded, the transfer would mark a sm...
docs.lead_paragraph: In September, U.S. State Department officials invited a foreign delegation to the Guantanamo Bay detention center to persuade the group to take detainee Tariq Ba Odah to their country. If they succeeded, the transfer would mark a small step toward realizing President Barack Obama's goal of closing the prison before he leaves office.

headline.main: Special Report: Pentagon Thwarts Obama's Effort to Close Guantanamo
headline.print_headline: Special Report: Pentagon Thwarts Obama's Effort to Close Guantanamo

docs.snippet: Doctors are testing ways to ease the cycle of hospitalization and lifetime disability that afflicts so many grappling with psychosis....
docs.lead_paragraph: Doctors are testing ways to ease the cycle of hospitalization and lifetime disability that afflicts so many grappling with psychosis.
docs.abstract: Emerging handful of small-scale programs are treating schizophrenia with combination of  sustained one-on-one therapy, school and work assistance, family education and medication; programs offer sufferers greater role in own treatment and provide alternative to poorly organized programs that focus on antipsychotic drugs.

headline.main: Programs Expand Schizophrenic Patients’ Role in Their Own Care
